title: Trace: Division by Zero
story: Mathematical operations can fail when dividing by zero. This classic error teaches you to validate numeric operations.
instructions: Analyze the stack trace and determine what caused the division error.

hints.text: ZeroDivisionError occurs when you try to divide or modulo by zero.
Always check if the denominator is zero before division.

traceReading.stackTrace:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "main.py", line 4, in <module>
    average = total / count
ZeroDivisionError: division by zero
traceReading.buggyCode:
scores = []
total = sum(scores)
count = len(scores)
average = total / count
print(average)

questions.question: On which line did the error occur?
How would you fix this code to handle empty lists?
questions.correctAnswer: Check if count > 0 before division, or use if statement
